info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 1:22PM CDT until July 14 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Austin/San Antonio TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following county, Kerr.
* WHEN...Until 400 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 122 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ingram, Hunt, Kerr Wildlife Management Area, Mountain Home, Waltonia and Harper. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON
